alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany; Tangipahoa; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 24 at 1:49PM CST until January 24 at 3:30PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHWESTERN ST. TAMMANY, SOUTHERN TANGIPAHOA AND WASHINGTON PARISHES AND NORTHWESTERN PEARL RIVER AND SOUTHEASTERN WALTHALL COUNTIES... At 149 PM CST, the public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain with water approaching businesses in downtown Covington along with water covering local roads. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hammond, Bogalusa, Covington, Franklinton, Abita Springs, Tylertown, Varnado, Madisonville, Folsom, Sun, Enon, Bush, Crossroads, Dexter, Robert, Natalbany and Angie. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 55 in Louisiana near mile marker 31. Interstate 12 between mile markers 40 and 67. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
